description:
The change of use of the ground floor from restaurant (Class
A3) to two, self-contained, two bedroom flats, and related
changes to layouts and elevations as a modification to a
scheme for a 4-storey (plus basement) building comprising a
Class A3 restaurant use at ground and lower ground floor
levels and 5 residential flats above, previously approved
subject to a Section 106 Agreement (unsigned) by Committee
dated 8.11.01 (Reg. No. PEX0100312R3),
as shown by drawing numbers HIRD[9-8]1.0PI, HIRD[9-8]2.0PJ,
HIRD[9-8]3.0PH, HIRD[9-8]4.0PF, HIRD[9-8]5.0PF, HIRD[9-
8]6.0PE, HIRD[9-8]7.0PG, HIRD[9-8]8.0PF, HIRD[09]1PC,
HIRD[09]1.1PC, HIRD[09]2PB, HIRD[09]2.1PB.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The ground floor elevation and front forecourt shall not be
    constructed other than in accordance with the detail as far
    as shown on approved drawing Nos. HIRD[09]2PB and
    HIRD[09]2.1PB.

Condition : 3 - Notwithstanding the detail shown on any of the submitted
    drawings, there shall be no window guards installed against
    any windows below first floor level.

Condition : 4 - The existing tree to the north-west of the site and
    annotated N12 on approved drawing no. HIRD[9-8]1.0PE, shall
    be retained and protected from damage to the satisfaction of
    the Council for a period of at least 12 months following the
    completion of the development hereby approved, or such
    longer period as may be required under Sections 198 and 211
    of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 5 - The windows on the south elevation of the approved building
    shall be obscure glazed in accordance with a scheme to be
    submitted to and approved by the Council in writing and
    shall be permanently retained in accordance with such scheme
    thereafter.

Condition : 6 - A privacy screen 1.7 metres height shall be erected in
    accordance with the detail annotated as N8 on approved
    drawing no. HIRD[9-8]3.0PH prior to the occupation of the
    top floor flat and shall remain fixed in place permanently
    thereafter other than for reasonable maintenance. The flat
    roof area between this screen and the stairwell shall not be
    used as an amenity space.

Condition : 7 - No part of the building may be occupied for the uses hereby
    approved until such time as the area adjacent the bin-store
    in Carrol Close, has been re-landscaped and adapted to allow
    for access to the bin-store, in accordance with a scheme for
    this purpose as prepared by the applicant and approved by
    the Council.

Condition : 8 - The crossover to the Highgate Road frontage shall be
    reinstated to the satisfaction of the Council prior to
    occupation of the development hereby approved.

Condition : 9 - The use hereby permitted shall not be begun before details
    of the arrangements for the storage of waste and refuse
    (including recycled materials) have been submitted to and
    approved by the Council and the development shall not be
    carried out otherwise than in accordance with any approval
    given.

Condition : 10 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to
    following planting season, with others of similar size and
    species, unless the Council gives written consent to any
    variation.
    a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved
    landscape details, prior to the occupation for the permitted
    use of the development or any phase of the development,
    whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of planting
    which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the
    development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or
    diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably
    possible and, in any case, by not later than the end of the

Condition : 11 - To ensure that the external appearance of the building will
    be satisfactory in accordance with the requirements of
    policies EN1 and EN14 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 12 - To ensure that the external appearance of the building will
    be satisfactory in accordance with the requirements of
    policies EN1 and EN14 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 13 - To ensure that the development will not create opportunities
    for crime in accordance with policy EN20 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 14 - In order to prevent unreasonable overlooking of neighbouring
    premises in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1
    and EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development
    Plan 2000.

Condition : 15 - In order to prevent unreasonable overlooking of neighbouring
    premises in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1
    and EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development
    Plan 2000.

Condition : 16 - To safeguard the amenities of adjoining premises and the
    area generally in order to ensure compliance with the
    requirements of policy RE2 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 17 - To safeguard the amenities of adjoining premises and the
    area generally in order to ensure compliance with the
    requirements of policy RE2 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 18 - To safeguard the visual amenity of the immediate area in
    accordance with the requirements of policy EN1 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 19 - To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a
    reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of
    visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the
    requirements of policy EN15 of the London Borough of
    Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 20 - Your attention is drawn to the fact that there is a separate
    legal agreement with the Council which relates to the
    development for which this permission is granted.

Condition : 21 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied that the
    development will not have an adverse effect on existing
    trees and in order to maintain the character and amenities
    of the area in accordance with the requirements of policy
    EN61 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development
    Plan 2000.
